snippet: Peddler, a sidewalk stand in SoHo with mismatched teacups dangling from hooks above a proper espresso machine, has all the trappings of an up-and-coming cafe, without the laptops.
abstract: Neighborhood Joint column on Peddler coffee stand, oddly configured mash-up of glass siding and scrap metal found on New York streets and assembled into food truck by Australian owner Byron Kaplan; stand is neighborhood fixture, at corner of Houston and Lafayette in SoHo, for tourists and regulars alike.
lead_paragraph: Peddler, a sidewalk stand in SoHo with mismatched teacups dangling from hooks above a proper espresso machine, has all the trappings of an up-and-coming cafe, without the laptops.

headline.print_headline: Coffee Shop With Wheels, Not Walls
headline.main: Coffee Connections at Peddler in SoHo
